alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Calhoun, Etowah, northeastern St. Clair and southwestern Cherokee Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sardis City to Attalla to near Ashville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Anniston, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Attalla, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Centre Municipal Airport, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ashville, Ragland, Ohatchee, Steele, Leesburg, Reece City, Cherokee Rock Village and Eastern Weiss Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
